text: <https://github.com/AnHeuermann/JuliaFMI/pull/57/checks?check_run_id=2168334853|This actions job> is failing because it can't find libgfortran3, which is fairly ancient, for <http://JModelica.org|JModelica.org> (not sure what this even is in the context because it's not a package). I can't work out which dependency needs this (<https://github.com/AnHeuermann/JuliaFMI/blob/master/Manifest.toml|Manifest.toml>). Does anyone have any good ideas of how to find out programmatically?

text: installing system libgfortran won't do much, julia comes with its own libgfortran, you have to match that one when loading external libraries
